title: Indian Charge d’Affaires summoned to convey Pakistan’s strong rejection of baseless Indian allegations
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jan 7 (APP):Indian Charge d’Affaires Gaurav Ahluwalia was summoned by Director General (South Asia & SAARC) Zahid Hafeez Chaudhri, on Tuesday, to convey Pakistan’s strong rejection of baseless and fabricated Indian allegations concerning the Sikh community, a foreign office press release said.
The DG (SA & SAARC) conveyed Pakistan’s strong denouncement of the Indian government’s motivated and mischievous allegations of “attack”, “vandalism” and “desecration” at the holy Gurdwara Nankana Sahib and “targeted killing” of a Pakistani Sikh youth in Peshawar, as part of its desperate attempts to divert attention from the continuing state terrorism in Indian Occupied Jammu & Kashmir (IOJ&K) and systematic discrimination against minorities in India.
The DG (SA&SAARC) underscored that the Constitution of Pakistan guarantees equal rights to all its citizens and the government was committed to protecting the rights of minorities, with zero-tolerance against any discrimination.
It was emphasized that rather than pointing fingers towards others, India should focus on ensuring effective protection of its own minorities and their holy places of worship, including Mosques, from repeated instances of desecration, hate crimes and mob lynchings.
